content.en: Algorithmic Materials Science: Researchers are exploring how algorithms can be used to tackle complex problems in materials science and solid mechanics. They are developing deep learning models, such as the deep material network and physics-informed neural networks, to predict mechanical responses, solve partial differential equations, and model deformation in materials. These algorithms are trained to incorporate physical laws and constraints, providing accurate and efficient solutions for a wide range of applications in the field.
content.da: Algoritmisk Materialevidenskab: Forskere udforsker, hvordan algoritmer kan bruges til at tackle komplekse problemer inden for materialvidenskab og faststofmekanik. De udvikler dyb læringsmodeller, såsom det dybe materialenetværk og fysikinformerede neurale netværk, for at forudsige mekaniske reaktioner, løse partielle differentialligninger og modellere deformation i materialer. Disse algoritmer trænes til at inkorporere fysiske love og begrænsninger, hvilket giver nøjagtige og effektive løsninger for en bred vifte af anvendelser inden for feltet.
